page.title: 14Local History ,S'key&C'thrp
page.content: {Archaeological:}(5,000 -3,000B.C.) flint for tools found at old salt water edge (50 feet above present sea level) quarried above Vale Farm. (ca 500B.C.) Warborough Hill, iron age Belgic funeral urns;(ca 300A.D.) Romano-British site above this may have been military look-out, broken shard, some wavy line decoration found in Long Meadow. River tidal till 16th.century. Danes sailed past to Warham. {Old names:}village divided in Saxon times. Wm. the Conqueror took east end, later{Stiffkey Banyard}(included in sixteenth century Bacon estate); western end{Netherall with Stowes.}The 'Stowes': hill to south, perhaps site of ancient 'moot' for Binham,Stiffkey, Warham.{Camping Hill;}'camping': old form of rough football outlawed to edge of village.
